alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 4:25PM CDT until June 21 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Kimble. This includes Junction. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms from 5 miles northeast of Junction to Junction to the South Llano State Park...moving south at 5 mph. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen 1 to 2 miles northeast of Junction. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Junction, South Llano River State Park, Yates Crossing and Telegraph. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 452 and 461...and between Mile Markers 473 and 477. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, US HWY 377 crossing South Llano River, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, US HWY 377 crossing 2 miles North of Telegraph, KC 314 crossing Llano River, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, CR 150 crossing South Llano River, Flatrock Ln. crossing South Llano River and crossings along County Road 410. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
